observation_configs.name: COPUS
observation_configs.description: Classroom Observation Protocol for Undergraduate Science Courses

student_actions.label: Ind
student_actions.text: Individual thinking / problem solving (when explicitly prompted)

student_actions.label: Prd
student_actions.text: Making a prediction about an outcome of a demo or experiment

student_actions.label: CG
student_actions.text: Discussing clicker question (CQ) in groups of 2 or more students

student_actions.label: OG
student_actions.text: Other group activities (e.g., responding to instructor question)

student_actions.label: WC
student_actions.text: Engaged in whole class discussion (offering explanations, opinions, etc.)

student_actions.label: W-S
student_actions.text: Waiting (e.g., instructor late or fixing AV problems)

instructor_actions.label: Lec
instructor_actions.text: Lecturing (presenting content, deriving results, problem solutions, etc.)

instructor_actions.label: RtW
instructor_actions.text: Real-time writing on board, document, or projector

instructor_actions.label: D/V
instructor_actions.text: Showing or conducting a demo, experiment, simulation, video, or animation

instructor_actions.label: PQ
instructor_actions.text: Posing non-rhetorical, non-clicker question

instructor_actions.label: CQ
instructor_actions.text: Asking a clicker question (mark entire time clicker question used)

instructor_actions.label: AnQ-I
instructor_actions.text: Listening to and answering student questions with entire class listening

instructor_actions.label: Fup
instructor_actions.text: Following up on clicker question or activity to entire class

instructor_actions.label: Si
instructor_actions.text: 'Stretch it' activity

instructor_actions.label: MG
instructor_actions.text: Moving through class, guiding work during active learning tasks

instructor_actions.label: 1o1
instructor_actions.text: One-on-one extended discussion with student(s)

instructor_actions.label: Adm
instructor_actions.text: Administration (assigning homework, returning tests, etc.)

instructor_actions.label: W-I
instructor_actions.text: Instructor waiting when could be interacting/observing students

instructor_actions.label: O-I
instructor_actions.text: Other instructor behavior (see comments)

engagement_images.label: High
engagement_images.text: Large fraction of students (80+%) clearly engaged in class activity or listening to instructor.

engagement_images.label: Medium
engagement_images.text: Substantial fractions both clearly engaged and clearly not engaged.

observation_configs.name: COPUS (test)
observation_configs.description: Classroom Observation Protocol for Undergraduate Science Courses
observation_configs.instructions:
Brief instructions for using the COPUS (test) observation method:

1. **Observe in 2-Minute Intervals**
   * Every 2 minutes, record all behaviors you observe during that interval â€” both for the **instructor** and **students**.
   * Multiple codes can be checked in the same interval if several behaviors occur.

2. **Use Only Observable Actions**
   * Focus on *what you can see and hear*, not on interpreting intent or quality.

4. **Continue for the Whole Class Period**
   * Keep recording every 2 minutes until the end of the class session.

5. **Summarize the Data**
   * After class, Use the Analysis Page to examine the frequency and trending of each behavior.
   * Analyze patterns (e.g., proportion of time spent lecturing vs. active learning).
